description: Aspose.Cells for .NET is a spreadsheet programming component that allows software developers to manipulate and convert spreadsheet files from within their own applications. A combination of APIs and GUI controls, Aspose.Cells for .NET speeds up Microsoft Excel programming and conversion.
releaseNotes:
Enhancements
40697 - Multiple Subtotals add extra row
40721 - Subsequent Subtotal Formulae not using correct range
40707 - Accessing Shapes data in MS Excel  
40703 - Map Properties not saved when saving a copy of an Excel file
40682 - Disable Compatibility Checker in MS Excel
40669 - Incorrect implementation/interpretation to open incorrect file format
 
Exceptions
40696 - NullReferenceException on opening/saving an XLSX file
40667 - Exception: There are too many formats in the worksheet
40680 - Arithmetic operation resulted in an overflow
40686 - NullReferenceException on saving for this simple example workbook
 
Bugs
40704 - Urgent: Functionality changed in "FindStringContains"
40708 - Performing Count Subtotal on Date column displays as Date
40710 - #Recursive Reference! Error
40730 - Copying file using Aspose Cells requires Repair work
40731 - Thinking an Excel 97 XLS file to be a Word document
40639 - Export to PDF chart is different from Excel version
40700 - Export to PDF chart is different from Excel version -2
40720 - Extra Lines are embedded in the charts
40746 - Text surrounded by quotes option in CSV file
40739 - Custom properties corrupted with Line break
40741 - MS Excel Calculations not completing before document is saved
40749 - Formula is not working fine
40605 - WorkSheetCollection.AddCopy not updating references
40725 - Issue when removing data source in Pivot Table
40728 - Issue with copying Pivot Table (Formatting)
40640 - Saving with Excel97-2003 format corrupts the file
40702 - Problems when clearing partial content of a table
40744 - Could not open the file created by the OXML SDK
summary: Aspose.Cells for .Net is a class library for Excel document processing
title: Aspose.Cells for .NET
